meanings.definition: To treat someone as a celebrity or hero.
meanings.sent1: The town was lionizing the local firefighter for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: The fans were lionizing the famous singer after her concert.
meanings.sent3: The children were lionizing their teacher by making a big poster for her.
meanings.sent4: The media was lionizing the politician, portraying him as a savior.
meanings.sent5: The company was lionizing the CEO, putting up billboards with his face everywhere.

meanings.definition: To give someone a lot of attention and admiration.
meanings.sent1: Everyone was lionizing the artist's latest masterpiece at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was lionizing the student for his exceptional performance in class.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lionizing its owner by bringing her gifts from the garden.
meanings.sent4: The community was lionizing the volunteer for her selfless dedication to helping others.
meanings.sent5: The team was lionizing the captain for leading them to victory in the championship game.

meanings.definition: To make someone seem important or famous.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team was lionizing the new product to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The press was lionizing the actor, creating a buzz around his upcoming movie.
meanings.sent3: The dog was lionizing its favorite toy, carrying it around everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The author was lionizing the main character, making readers fall in love with him.
meanings.sent5: The school was lionizing the principal, highlighting her achievements in the newsletter.
